artist: Artist: Annibale Carracci; Etcher: After Carlo Cesio; Printer: Unknown
description: young man at left, standing, legs crossed, arms crossed over head; young man at center, semi-reclining leaning left; old man center (statue or pillar?), hands covered holding cloak; at right circular medallion with male figure and partial female figure; puti above with animal faces; human face at bottom
inscription:
Inscription

on verso in brown: [Annibale Carracci/ Born 1560 died 1609/ I\'ve seen a few etchings by the hand of this Great/ Master which are retouched by the graver/ though the Point appears to be taken up for   Amug.../ only the Hand of the Master is visible/ ...]; on mount in pencil [1-230]
title: Ignudi and Roundel Depicting Orpheus and Eurydice from Annibale Carracci's Galleria Farnese
